events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection during heavy rain.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing initial details about the vehicle collision and scene description.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim and coordinate further processing and communication with the customer.
The claim was formally acknowledged and confirmation sent to the insured customer along with next steps for documentation.
Request for police report, vehicle damage photos, and driver’s statement was sent to the customer to support claim evaluation.
The customer provided all requested documents, including detailed photos of the damaged car and the official police collision report.
The investigation team began assessing the circumstances of the accident and verifying submitted materials for claim validation.
After a thorough review of the accident details and documentation, the investigation was completed with no discrepancies.
A settlement offer was proposed based on repair estimates and policy coverage, communicated clearly to the insured customer.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and confirmed agreement to proceed with the payment process.
The claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the settlement terms and confirmation of document accuracy.
The settlement payment was issued electronically to the customer’s account to cover the vehicle repair costs as agreed.
The claim case was formally closed after confirming that the payment was received and no further issues were reported.
All documentation and records related to the claim were archived in compliance with data retention policies for future reference.
